summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR. WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED, THE CONTACT NOTICED AN ODOR OF BURNING RUBBER AND PLASTIC. THE VEHICLE BECAME ENGULFED WITH SMOKE AND FLAMES. THE CONTACT EXTINGUISHED THE FIRE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED NOR REPAIRED. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE BURNED BODY ON THE HOOD OF THE VEHICLE WAS ABOVE THE MASTER CYLINDER. NO REPORT WAS FILED. THE CONTACT FOUND THAT THE VEHICLE WAS INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 05V017000 (VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL); HOWEVER, THE CONTACT HAD NEVER RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF THE RECALL AND THE VEHICLE HAD NEVER RECEIVED A RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 130,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE PARKED, HE WAS MADE AWARE THAT THE VEHICLE WAS ON FIRE. THE FIRE DEPARTMENT EXTINGUISHED THE FIRE.  THE VEHICLE WAS DESTROYED AND REMAINED IN THE CONTACT'S DRIVE WAY, WHICH WAS ADVISED BY THE FIRE DEPARTMENT.  THE FIRE DEPARTMENT STATED THAT THE FIRE STARTED FROM UNDER THE HOOD ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE BUT THE DIRECT ORIGINA OF THE FIRE WAS UNKNOWN.  THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE.  THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 190,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 40 MPH, THE BRAKES WOULD NOT RESPOND. THE CONTACT HAD TO APPLY EXCESSIVE PRESSURE TO THE BRAKE PEDAL AND PUMP IT REPEATEDLY. ADDITIONALLY, THE AIR BAG WARNING LIGHT ILLUMINATED INTERMITTENTLY. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC FOR DIAGNOSIS. THE MECHANIC STATED THERE WAS A REAR BRAKE SEAL LEAK. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 200,000.   *TR
1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR, REGARDING A POTENTIAL UNDERHOOD FIRE  RISK.  CONSUMER STATED VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE.    UPDATED 06/26/12 *BF   THE CONSUMER SENT SUPPLIED THE RECALL NOTICE. RECALL# 07V336000. *JB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THERE WAS A RECALL ON THE SPEED CONTROL SWITCH, WHICH CAUSED HIS VEHICLE TO CATCH FIRE.  THE SWITCH WAS NEVER REPLACED BECAUSE THE CONTACT NEVER RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE FOR THE CRUISE CONTROL SWITCH.  AFTER THE FIRE, THE MECHANIC STATED THAT THE SWITCH WAS THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURE.  THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED AND UNOCCUPIED AT THE TIME OF THE FIRE.  THE FIRE DEPARTMENT EXTINGUISHED THE FLAMES AND FILED A REPORT.  THE NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 180,000.

1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR   THE LOWER BALL JOINT ON THE FRONT DRIVERS SIDE OF THE CAR SUDDENLY BROKE IN HALF ALLOWING THE LOWER CONTROL ARM OF THE CAR TO FALL TO THE GROUND.  FORTUNATELY, I WAS JUST PARKING WHEN IT HAPPENED.  THEIR WAS NO WARNING OF A PROBLEM WITH THE BALL JOINT.  THE CAR DROVE FINE.  I UNDERSTAND THAT A RECALL EXISTS FOR THIS PROBLEM (98S37), BUT ACCORDING TO THE DEALER, MY CAR IS NOT COVERED BY THE RECALL.  OBVIOUSLY, IT SHOULD BE. *TR

MY ELDERLY PARENTS WERE DRIVING IN A STRAIGHT LINE AT LOW SPEED WHEN THE LOWER CONTROL ARM BALL JOINT FAILED. THE CONTROL ARM DROPPED, DUG INTO THE PAVEMENT AND RENDERED THE CAR OUT OF CONTROL. LUCKILY NO ONE WAS INJURED. IT WAS VERY DIFFICULT TO JACK UP THE CAR, SLIDE A DOLLY UNDER IT, TOW IT HOME, ETC. THERE HAVE BEEN SEVERAL COMPLAINTS ON THIS EXACT PROBLEM. A RECALL ADDRESSING THIS SERIOUS LIFE THREATENING DEFECT HAS BEEN ISSUED ON VEHICLES OF THE SAME MODEL, YEAR AND CONSTRUCTION; BUT, NOT ALL VIN WERE COVERED IN THE RECALL. AS OF THIS DATE NO WORK HAS BEEN DONE TO CORRECT THE FAILURE. *TR
THE LEFT FRONT AND RIGHT REAR DRIVER SEAT MOUNTING BRACKETS BROKE. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE CONTACT'S VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE WHILE PARKED AT HIS HOME.  THE FIRE DEPARTMENT STATED THAT THE FIRE WAS DUE TO VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL: CRUISE CONTROL FAILURE.  A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED AND THE CONTACT HAS PICTURES OF THE FAILED COMPONENT.  HIS INSURANCE COMPANY WILL NOT ASSUME ANY LIABILITY FOR THE VEHICLE.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT HE NEVER RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 07V336000 (VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL).  HE IS IN THE PROCESS OF NOTIFYING THE MANUFACTURER.  THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE 123,000.  UPDATED 07/22/08 *BF  UPDATED 07/22/08 *JB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER TO HAVE IT SERVICED FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 07V336000 (VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL).  AFTER THE RECALL REPAIR WAS PERFORMED, SHE ATTEMPTED TO USE THE CRUISE CONTROL, BUT IT DID NOT WORK.  THE CONTACT RETURNED TO THE DEALER TO HAVE THE CRUISE CONTROL SWITCH INSPECTED AND WAS INFORMED THAT A CHARGE WOULD APPLY TO HAVE THE VEHICLE INSPECTED.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 80,000.

1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR WITH A RECALL. CONSUMER STATES THAT HE HAS CALLED THE DEALER SEVERAL TIMES AND KEEPS GETTING AN ANSWERING MACHINE AND NO ONE WILL RETURN HIS CALL. HE WOULD LIKE TO KNOW WHAT TO DO ABOUT THIS PROBLEM.  *KB

components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL
summary: 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR MOTOR CAUGHT FIRE. CONSUMER STATES THAT HER MOTOR CAUGHT ON FIRE. SHE SAYS THAT FORD DOES NOT CARE. SHE WOULD LIKE FORD TO GIVE HER $500.00 FOR A NEW MOTOR.  *KB  THE FIRE MAY HAVE BEEN DUE TO A FAULTY SPEED CONTROL DEACTIVATION SWITCH.  *JB

1999 FORD EXPLORER AND 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR WITH SPEED CONTROL RECALL. CONSUMER STATES THAT THE CRUISE CONTROL WAS DISCONNECTED BACK IN OCTOBER OF 2007. DEALER TOLD HIM THAT FORD HAS NOT SENT THE REPLACEMENT PARTS YET.  *KB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  WITH THE BRAKE PEDAL DEPRESSED, THE CONTACT WAS STOPPED BETWEEN A TRACTOR TRAILER AND ANOTHER VEHICLE.  THE ENGINE REVVED AND THE VEHICLE BEGAN TO MOVE FORWARD WITHOUT WARNING.  THE CONTACT THEN STRUCK THE REAR OF THE TRAILER.  THE POLICE ARRIVED ON THE SCENE AND FILED A REPORT.  THE CONTACT WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL AND SUSTAINED FACE AND CHEST BRUISES FROM THE AIR BAG DEPLOYMENT.  THE VIN, ENGINE SIZE, NUMBER OF CYLINDERS, AND POWERTRAIN WERE UNKNOWN.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 160,278.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE ABS WARNING LIGHT ILLUMINATED.  WHEN THE CONTACT DEPRESSED THE BRAKE PEDAL AND ATTEMPTED TO STOP, THE VEHICLE FAILED TO STOP COMPLETELY.  THE CONTACT HAD TO APPLY EXCESSIVE FORCE TO THE BRAKE PEDAL, APPLY THE EMERGENCY BRAKE, AND PLACE THE VEHICLE IN NEUTRAL IN ORDER FOR IT TO STOP.  OCCASIONALLY, HE HAS TO OPEN THE VEHICLE DOOR AND APPLY THE EMERGENCY BRAKE AT A CERTAIN ANGLE.  ADDITIONALLY, BRAKE FLUID IS LEAKING INTO THE VEHICLE AND ONTO THE BRAKE PEDAL.  HE WAS INFORMED THAT THE PRIMARY AND SECONDARY CUPS MAY HAVE LEAKED THROUGH THE BRAKE BOOSTER.  THE CONTACT HAS BEEN DENIED ASSISTANCE FROM SEVERAL DEALERS, EMERGENCY SERVICE MECHANICS, AND AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC.  THE SPEED WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 237,576 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 295,350.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  WHILE DRIVING 50 MPH WITH THE CRUISE CONTROL ACTIVATED, THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS DEPRESSED, BUT THE CRUISE CONTROL WOULD NOT DEACTIVATE.  THE BRAKE PEDAL HAD TO BE DEPRESSED TWICE BEFORE THE CRUISE CONTROL DEACTIVATED.  THE FAILURE OCCURRED INTERMITTENTLY.  THE CHECK ENGINE WARNING LIGHT ILLUMINATED.  THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INSPECTED BY A DEALER.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 100,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 164,000.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE CONTACT RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 07V336000 (VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL).  FORD STATED THAT THE PART FOR THE RECALL REPAIR WOULD BE UNAVAILABLE UNTIL AUGUST OF 2008.  THERE HAD BEEN NO FAILURE TO DATE.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 75,500.

A RECALL WAS INITIATED 6 MONTHS AGO FOR FAULTY FUSED WIRING HARNESSES ON MANY FORD/MERCURY/LINCOLN VEHICLES. THE RECALL BEGAN ON AUGUST 13, 2007. THIS RECALL WAS THE SUBJECT OF AN ENGINEERING ANALYSIS, EA05-005, CONDUCTED BY THE OFFICE OF DEFECTS INVESTIGATION. 07V-336. IN THE FALL OF 2007 DEALERS TOLD OWNERS THAT THE REPAIR PARTS WOULD NOT BE AVAILABLE UNTIL DECEMBER 2007, NOW DEALERS ARE TELLING OWNERS THAT THE PART IS STILL NOT AVAILABLE AND PROJECTED THAT IT WON'T BE UNTIL MARCH 2008.    WHY HAS FORD BEEN ALLOWED TO DRAG IT'S FEET FOR 9 MONTHS ON REPAIRING A SAFETY HAZARD?  WHEN CAN OWNERS EXPECT TO HAVE A PROPERLY RESTORED VEHICLE?  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE CONTACT RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE FOR THE VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL IN AUGUST OF 2007.  SHE HAS BEEN INFORMED EVERY MONTH THEREAFTER THAT THE PARTS WOULD  BE AVAILABLE THE FOLLOWING MONTH.  THERE HAD BEEN NO FAILURE TO DATE.  THE PURCHASE DATE, POWERTRAIN, AND RECALL NUMBER WERE UNKNOWN.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 133,000.
LETTER ABOUT RECALL NOTICE FROM FORD ON 09/07/07 RE A PROBLEM WITH THE CRUISE CONTROL FEATURE ON FORD VEHICLES, HAVING TROUBLE IN GETTING THIS PROBLEM FIXED ON HIS 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  *KB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  WHILE DRIVING 70 MPH, THE CONTACT ATTEMPTED TO DISENGAGE THE CRUISE CONTROL BY DEPRESSING THE BRAKE PEDAL.  THE FEATURE WOULD NOT DISENGAGE AND THE VEHICLE SUDDENLY ACCELERATED AND CAUGHT FIRE.  FORD MOTOR COMPANY STATED THAT THEY WOULD SEND A LETTER WITHIN 7-10 DAYS.  FORD WOULD NOT INFORM HIM IF THE VIN WAS INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 07V336000 (VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL) AND FORD RECALL NUMBER 05S28.  THE REPRESENTATIVE GAVE HIM A WEBSITE TO ENTER IN THE VIN AND IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS INCLUDED IN THE RECALL.  THE VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE 30 MINUTES AFTER IT WAS PURCHASED.  THE FIRE AND POLICE DEPARTMENTS ARRIVED AND FILED A REPORT.  THE VEHICLE WAS DESTROYED.  THE POWERTRAIN WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE 187,000.

1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR WITH A RECALL FOR CRUISE CONTROL. CONSUMER STATES THAT MECHANIC DISCONNECTED THE CRUISE CONTROL BECAUSE THE PARTS WERE NOT IN TO REPAIR THE PROBLEM. HE STATED THE PARTS WOULD BE IN THE FOLLOWING MONTH UP UNTIL NOVEMBER.  *KB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE CONTACT RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 07V336000 (VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL).  THE VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL WAS DISCONNECTED IN SEPTEMBER OF 2007 AND HE WAS INFORMED THAT THE PARTS WOULD BE AVAILABLE IN DECEMBER.  THE CONTACT CALLED THE MANUFACTURER IN JANUARY OF 2008 AND WAS INFORMED THAT THE PARTS MAY ARRIVE IN MARCH.  THERE HAD BEEN NO FAILURE TO DATE.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 64,000.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE CONTACT RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE IN SEPTEMBER OF 2007 FOR THE VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL.  HE NOTIFIED THE DEALER IN NOVEMBER AND DECEMBER, BUT WAS INFORMED ON BOTH OCCASIONS THAT THE PARTS WERE UNAVAILABLE.  FORD MOTOR COMPANY STATED THAT "THE FAIRY GODMOTHER HAS NOT YET GIVEN THEM A DATE AND IT COULD BE ANYWHERE FROM 6-9 MONTHS THEREAFTER".  HE STATED THAT DUE TO ADVERSE WEATHER CONDITIONS AND THE LUXURY OF HAVING THE FEATURE, THIS WAS A TOTAL INCONVENIENCE.  THE CRUISE CONTROL DEACTIVATION SWITCH WAS DISCONNECTED.  THERE HAD BEEN NO FAILURE TO DATE.  THE RECALL NUMBER WAS UNKNOWN.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 103,989.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THE CONTACT WAS UNABLE TO START THE VEHICLE AND HAD TO RECEIVE A JUMP IN ORDER FOR IT TO START.  APPROXIMATELY TWO DAYS LATER, THE FAILURE RECURRED.  THE CONTACT REPLACED THE BATTERY; HOWEVER, THE FAILURE RECURRED FOUR MONTHS LATER.  THE DEALER INSPECTED THE VEHICLE ON SIX OCCASIONS, BUT WAS UNABLE TO DIAGNOSE THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURES.  THE CONTACT REPLACED THE BATTERY ON FOUR OCCASIONS; HOWEVER, THE FAILURE CONTINUED.  THE POWERTRAIN WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 21,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 36,528.

RECALL CAMPAIGN 07V336000 IS NOT BEING IMPLEMENTED.   FORD IS SIMPLY DESTROYING THE VEHICLE'S CRUISE CONTROL AND SINCE THEIR LIABILITY IS THUS ELIMINATED, THEY ARE SYSTEMATICALLY DRAGGING THEIR FEET IN REPAIRING CARS.   THE FIX PROMISED IN OCTOBER 2007 IS NOW CLAIMED TO NOT BE AVAILABLE UNTIL DEC. 2007.   MY PARENTS CAR HAS BEEN RENDERED UNUSABLE FOR TRIPS SINCE AUGUST AND NOW THEY WILL NOT BE ABLE TO TRAVEL FOR THANKSGIVING OR CHRISTMAS!!!   ONE IS DISABLED AND CANNOT DRIVE AND THE OTHER HAS LEG SPASM PROBLEMS AND MUST USE CRUISE CONTROL FOR SAFE DRIVING FOR MORE THAN AN HOUR.   FORD REFUSES TO RECONNECT THE SYSTEM PENDING THEIR FIX WHICH I SUSPECT WILL NEVER APPEAR.  THANKS FOR NOTHING DOT AND FORD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  AFTER BEING PARKED IN THE DRIVEWAY FOR A COUPLE OF HOURS, THE VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE AND EXPLODED.  THE MONTGOMERY COUNTY FIRE INVESTIGATOR STATED THAT THE VEHICLE'S WIRING HARNESS, WHICH WAS NEAR THE FUEL LINE, WAS THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURE.  THE FIRE ENGULFED THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT AND THE VEHICLE WAS DESTROYED.  A FIRE REPORT WAS FILED.  THE CONTACT'S VEHICLE WAS INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 07V336000 (VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL); HOWEVER, SHE WAS NEVER NOTIFIED OF THE RECALL PRIOR TO THE FIRE.  SHE FEARS THAT OTHER PEOPLE MAY BE EXPERIENCING SIMILAR FAILURES AND ARE NOT BEING NOTIFIED.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 88,000.

TWO 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CARS WERE PARKED IN OWNERS GARAGE. AT APPROXIMATELY 10PM, A LOUD BANG  WAS HEARD INSIDE THE HOUSE.  THE OWNER'S HUSBAND WENT OUT THE BACK DOOR TO INVESTIGATE AND CALLED BACK TO CALL 911 BECAUSE MY CAR  WAS ABLAZE. THE POLICE AND FIRE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED. THE CONTAINED THE BLAZE AFTER TWO HOURS.  MY CAR WAS TOTALLY DESTROYED AND MY HUSBAND'S CAR DRIVER'S SIDE SUSTAINED PAINT DAMAGE, BLOWN FRONT LEFT TIRE AND MELTED FRONT TURN AND HEAD LIGHT. NEITHER CAR HAD BEEN DRIVEN THE PREVIOUS FIVE HOURS AND THE KEYS WERE NOT IN THE IGNITION. THE FIRE ORIGINATED ON THE DRIVER'S SIDE UNDER THE HOOD. *TR

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 35 MPH ON NORMAL CITY ROAD CONDITIONS THERE WAS COMPLETE BRAKE FAILURE  WHICH ALMOST CAUSED THE VEHICLE HIT ANOTHER VEHICLE DRIVING IN FRONT.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALERSHIP WHO OBSERVED RUSTING IN THE HYDRAULIC LINE. THE LINE WAS LOCATED UNDER THE DRIVER SIDE. FLUID LEAKED OUT OF THE LINE LEAVING THE REAR WHEELS WITHOUT BRAKING ACTION.  THE CONTACT EXPRESSED CONCERN BECAUSE THE FLUID LINES WERE NOT STAINLESS STEEL MANUFACTURED. THERE WAS A RECALL # 95V133000 FOR THE VEHICLE HOWEVER IT DID NOT MENTION THE CORROSION AS A FACTOR FOR POSSIBLE FLUID LEAKAGE.*AK  UPDATED 11/03/06. *JB
DT: THE CONTACT STATED THE FRONT LEFT BALL JOINT FELL OFF OF HIS OF  1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  THIS HAPPENED ON 9-16-05. THIS WAS THE FIRST TIME THIS HAS HAPPENED.*AK  *JB

WE WERE DRIVING AND ALMOST HAD A HEAD ON COLLISION DUE TO A BROKEN SUB-FRAME MOUNT PLATE WHICH ENTIRELY BROKE.  UPON CHECKING WE FOUND THERE WAS A RECALL AND CHECKED WITH FORD AND THEY INFORMED US IT WAS NOT COVERED BECAUSE THERE WERE ONLY SELECT CARS DESIGNATED FOR THIS RECALL.   WE FELL THAT WE  HAVE A VALID RECALL AS THE SUB-FRAME COMPLETELY BROKE OFF ALMOST CAUSING US TO HAVE  A HEAD-ON COLISION.  UPON TALKING TO FORD  AT 866 436-7332, WE WERE TOLD THAT THIS WAS OUR PROBLEM AND THEY COULD DO NOTHING ABOUT IT EVEN THOUGH THERE WAS A RECALL FOR 1988-1994 LINCOLN CONTINENTAL VEHICLES.

WHILE DRIVING MY 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR AT 20-25 MPH IN HOPEWELL NJ MY DRIVERS SIDE LOWER BALL JOINT SEPARATED,CAUSING THE LOWER CONTROL ARM TO FALL TO THE GROUND AND THE WHEEL WELL TO FALL ON THE TOP SIDE OF THE RIGHT FRONT TIRE,RENDERING THE VEHICLE IMMOVABLE.  THE CAR WAS THEN TOWED 42 MILES TO MY HOME ON A FLATBED TRUCK AT THE COST OF $192.00.  WITH THE AID OF A NEIGHBOR (A PROFESSIONAL MECHANIC) THE BALL JOINT WAS REPLACED WITH AN AFTERMARKET PART,COST $52.00(NO LABOR COST-SELF INSTALLED).THE BROKEN BALL JOINT( I HAVE RETAINED THE BROKEN PART IN MY POSSESSION) DID NOT HAVE ANY FITTINGS FOR LUBRICATION,BUT ACCORDING TO FORD CUSTOMER SERVICE DIVISION IN DEARBORN MI( MR.PAUL LAFFIN ) MY VEHICLE WAS NOT PART OF ANY SAFETY RECALL(98S37 FORD'S # ) OR 98V322000.I WAS ADVISED THAT I SHOULD TAKE MY CAR TO THE NEAREST LINCOLN DEALER FOR INSPECTION AND OR SERVICE OF THE OTHER (RIGHT SIDE) BALL JOINT.  MY DRIVING TO AND FROM WORK INVOLVES 15 MILES ON AN INTERSTATE HIGHWAY,I GUESS I WAS JUST LUCKY TO HAVE THIS FAILURE OCCUR ON A CITY STREET AT 20 MPH.  I AM VERY DISSATISFIED WITH FORD,LINCOLN FOR THEIR RESPONSE  TO MY ISSUE WHICH I BELIEVE IS A DEFECTIVE PART THAT THEY REFUSE TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR AND CORRECT.  EVEN IF MY CAR WAS NOT IN THE ORIGINAL RECALL, I FEEL IT IS A SIMILAR ISSUE THAT SHOULD BE ADDRESSED IN A LIKE MANNER WHEN IT HAS BEEN BROUGHT TO THEIR ATTENTION.  AS FOR NHSTA I WOULD LIKE YOUR OFFICE TO LOOK INTO THE ASSEMBLY SPECS FOR ALL 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CARS TO SEE IF ALL WERE EQUIPPED WITH THIS TYPE OF (UNGREASEABLE) BALL JOINT. THANK YOU.  *NM

MY CAR, A 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR, CAUGHT FIRE AND BURNED SITTING IN MY DRIVE WITH THE ENGINE TURNED OFF.  I HAD PARKED IT AND TURNED THE ENGINE OFF 5 1/2 HOURS EARLIER BEFORE THE INCIDENT.  THE CAR WAS A TOTAL LOSS THERE WAS AN EXPLOSION( I SUPPOSE IT WAS DUE TO ONE OF THE TIRES BLOWING OUT) THAT THREW SOME DEBRIS FROM ONE OF THE PARTS THAT BURNED INTO THE SIDE OF THE HOUSE CAUSING A HOLE IN THE SIDING ON MY HOUSE AND THE HEAT FROM THE FIRE ALSO BUCKLED THE VINYL SIDING ON MY HOUSE..  I HAVE REPORTED THIS INCIDENT TO FORD MOTOR COMPANY, BUT THEY DO NOT SEEM TOO INTERESTED IN INVESTIGATING TO SEE WHAT CAUSED THE FIRE TO START. I AM INCLUDING PICTURES OF THE BURNED CAR AND A COPY OF THE FIRE DEPARTMENT'S REPORT.  *NM

OWNER HAD TROUBLE WITH REAR AIR-RIDE SUSPENSION FOR ABOUT A WEEK.  WARNING LIGHT INTERMITTENTLY ACTIVATED AFTER REPAIRS.  VEHICLE WAS PARKED ABOUT 13 HRS WHEN FIRE STARTED IN LEFT FRONT ENGINE COMPARTMENT. VEHICLE SUFFERED MAJOR DAMAGE.  ADJACENT RESIDENCE SUFFERED MODERATE DAMAGE
WHILE PARKED IN A GARAGE THE CONSUMER'S 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR CAUGHT ON FIRE.   *NM   *SC *JB

THE VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE WHILE PARKED WITHOUT WARNING.  THE DRIVER CALLED THE FIRE DEPARTMENT TO EXTINGUISHED THE FIRE. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED AND TOTALED OUT BY THE INSURANCE COMPANY.  PLEASE FILL IN ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.   *NM
CRUISE CONTROL STOPPED WORKING. NEXT DAY CAR CAUGHT ON FIRE WHILE PARKED.  *AK
DRIVER GOT INSIDE THE VEHICLE, TURNED ON THE IGNITION, AND THE VEHICLE BURSTED INTO FLAMES. THE FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS NOTIFIED, AND EXTINGUISHED THE FIRE.  *AK

THE HEADLIGHTS SUDDENLY TURNED OFF WHEN THE CONSUMER WAS DRIVING AT NIGHT.  THE LIGHTS WOULD COME ON WHEN THE MANUAL SWITCH WAS ON.   *SC   WHILE DRIVING AT NIGHT AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS, THE LIGHTS WENT OUT. THE LIGHTS CAME BACK ON BY USE OF THE ON SWITCH.  DEALER STATED THAT THEY HAVE NO IDEA HOW TO FIX THIS PROBLEM.  *TC  *JB

THE FUEL FROM THE TANK AND THE RETURN LINE WERE BURNED. THE VEHICLE  LEAKED GAS RIGHT ABOVE THE EXHAUST SYSTEM. THE CONSUMER CONTACTED THE MANUFACTURER AND RECEIVED NO ASSISTANCE. PROVIDE FURTHER DETAILS.   *JB

DEFECTIVE BRAKE LINES ON 1994 LINCOLN TOWN CAR.*MR  BOTH BRAKES LINES BURST LEAVING THE CONSUMER WITH NO BRAKES.  UPON FURTHER INSPECTION THE CONSUMER NOTICED THAT THE METAL LINES HAD CORRODED, POSSIBLY FROM ROAD SALT.  *NM

THE LOW BEAM HEADLIGHTS ARE INSUFFICIENT DUE TO THE DULLING OF INTERNAL COMPONENTS AS THE RESULT OF AN APPARENT DESIGN DEFECT. THE MFG. USED A 9005 BULB WITH A DIFFUSER. THE BULB AND DIFFUSER GENERATE EXCESSIVE HEAT AND HAVE DULLED THE REFLECTIVE MATERIAL INSIDE THE HEADLAMP ASSEMBLY. THE 9005 BULB IS A HIGH BEAM BULB USED, IN THIS CASE, IN A LOW BEAM ASSEMBLY.  I URGE THE NHTSA TO INVESTIGATE THIS MATTER AS IT SEEMS TO BE A COMMON COMPLAINT COUPLED WITH A SERIOUS SAFETY HAZARD.   *LA

WHILE COMING TO A STOP SIGN CONSUMER DEPRESSED THE BRAKE PEDAL.  CONSUMER CHECKED UNDER THE HOOD AND FOUND THAT THE BRAKE FLUID LEVEL WAS LESS THAN HALF FULL.  VEHICLE WAS TAKEN HOME, AND THE BRAKE LINE WAS FOUND TO BE RUPTURED.  *AK

THE SOLENOID WHICH UNLATCHES THE DRIVER-SIDE FRONT DOOR ON MY 1994 LINCOLN TOWNCAR FAILED.  WITH THE SOLENOID INOPERABLE, THER IS NO MECHANICAL MEANS OF UNLATCHING THE DRIVER DOOR.  FORTUNATELY, THE PASSENGER DOOR HAD UNLATCHED, SO EGRESS WAS POSSIBLE. *AK    IN THE EVENT OF A FIRE OR OTHER LIFE-THREATENING SITUATION, THE DRIVER WOULD BE TRAPPED IN THE VEHICLE.    WHILE THIS IS AN OLDER AUTOMOBILE, IT IS IN EXCELLENT CONDITION AND HAS JUST OVER 50,000 MILES.  I HAVE OWNED THE CAR SINCE IT WAS NEW, AND IT HAS HAD ALL DEALER RECOMMENDED SERVICE UNTIL THE 6-YEAR WARRANTY PERIOD ENDED.  SINCE THAT TIME, IT HAS BEEN CARED FOR BY A PRIVATELY OWNED SHOP, BUT THE MECHANIC IS WELL CERTIFIED.    THE AUTOMOBILE HAS PROVIDED EXCELLENT SERVICE OTHERWISE, AND I ALSO OWN A 2002 LINCOLN TOWNCAR.  I HAVE NO COMPLAINT AGAINST THE FORD MOTOR COMPANY, BUT AS A REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER, I BELIEVE IT IS MY DUTY TO REPORT THIS PROBLEM.    IF I CAN BE OF FURTHER ASSISTANCE, PLEASE ADVISE.    THANK YOU,    ROBERT W. PHILLPOTT, P.E.

THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT CAUGHT FIRE ON THE DRIVERS SIDE.  THE FIRE STARTED WHILE PARKED WITH THE KEY OUT OF THE IGNITION.  THE FIRE SPREADED TO THE HOUSE.  FIRE INVESTIGATOR, CHAD BIBLE, CALLED THIS COMPLAINT IN FOR OWNER WILLIAM LARNER AT 6823 WINDOVER WAY, TITUSVILLE, NC.   *AK   *SC

DRIVERS SEAT MOUNTING BRACKET TORN FROM SEAT FRAME.  IT APPEARS TO BE A METAL FATIGUE PROBLEM OR POSSIBLE A STRENGTH PROBLEM. DRIVER ENDED  UP IN REAR SEAT.  AT LEAST TWELVE OTHER IDENTICAL COMPLAINTS HAVE BEEN FILED ON THIS VEHICLE.  *AK
CONSUMER COMPLAINED  THAT RIGHT FRONT PASSENGER DOOR WOULD NOT OPEN.*AK

CONSUMER PARKED VEHICLE IN THE DRIVEWAY AND WENT INTO THE HOUSE.  ABOUT TWENTY MINUTES LATER  VEHICLE CAUGHT ON FIRE.  THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT ARRIVED AND EXTINGUISHED THE BLAZE.  THE WIRING MELTED.  *AK

FRAME OF THE DRIVER'S SEAT  BROKE, MAKING IT UNSAFE TO DRIVE THE VEHICLE. DEALER NOTIFIED.   *AK   THIS MAY BE THE SAME PROBLEM AS WITH THE 00' EXPLORER AND MOUNTAINEER VEHICLE'S.  THE OIL PAN LEAKED OIL.   *SC

components: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING
summary: AIR COND. PROBLEM= AIR- HEAT  DIRERCION MOTOR FAILED. BRAKE FAILER PROBLEM= TOTAL BRAKE FAILER ,PETAL FAILER DURING A NON PANIC STOP DUE TO BACKED UP TRAFFIC ON X-WAY. TWO PUMPS ON THE PETAL AND IT WENT DOWN TO THE FLOOR BOARD. I WAS ABLE TO MISS THE CAR BY A PANIC TURN TO THE LEFT. I JUST MISSED THE STOP CAR ON THE ROAD STILL DOING 45 MPH. CAR WAS HAULED TO ALEX KARRAS LINCOLN MERCURY FOR REPAIR..  NO HELP IN CONTACTING FORD FOR HELP. BRAKES LINES NEXT TO THE FRAME UNDER THE DRIVER SEAT WERE RUSTED OUT. THE RUSTED LINESWERE NOT SAVED.
PAINT FADED IN SPOTS ON ROOF AND TRUNK LID.  *JB

THIS IS A SAFETY ISSUE CONCERNING A 1994 LINCOLN TOWNCAR WITH 122000 MILES.  THE DRIVERS SEAT LEFT FRONT SEAT BOLT THAT HOLDS THE SEAT TO THE ANGLE IRON FRAME PULLED OUT OF OR THROUGH THE METAL OF THE SEAT.  THE CAR HAS NOT BEEN IN AN ACCIDENT AND THE AIR BAG HAS NEVER BEEN DEPLOYED SO THERE HAS NOT BEEN ANY EXTREME FORCE ON THE SEAT OTHER THAN DRIVING.  I WEIGH 200 LBS. AND DO NOT BELIEVE THAT WOULD BE CONSIDERED TO BE EXCESSIVE.  I SINCERELY BELIEVE THAT THIS SHOULD BE ADDRESSED AS A POSSIBLE DANGER FOR DRIVING AND IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENT THE DRIVERS AND/OR PASSENGERS SEAT COULD TEAR ITSELF LOOSE CAUSING ADDITIONAL INJURIES.  *TR
WHILE DRIVING THE BOLT THAT HOLDS THE DRIVER SIDE SEAT TO THE FRAME OF THE VEHICLE CAME DETACHED CAUSING THE SEAT TO BE MOBILE.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE DETAILS. TS

CONSUMER STATES THAT 2 MICHELIN TIRES EXPERIENCED BLOWOUTS DUE TO TREAD SEPARATIONS FROM THE STEELBELTS, 2 OF THE OTHER TIRES HAD STEEL WIRES THAT CAME THROUGH THE SIDES OF THE CROWN AREAS, THE OTHER TIRE DEVELOPED HOLES WHICH ALLOWED THE TIRE TO LEAK AIR, MICHELIN STEELBELT RADIALS, XW4 M AND S 97S, P215/70R15, DOT NUMBER HTC7585X044. CONSUMER STATES THE HEAD LIGHT LENSES ARE DISCOLORED CAUSING POOR VISIBILITY WHEN DRIVING AT NIGHT. THE MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN CONTACTED. *JB  CONSUMER ADDS AT ANY SPEED, A 2-CAR LENGTH DISTANCE OF ILLUMINATION IS WAY TOO SHORT FOR PERSONAL SAFETY AND DRIVER RESPONSE TIME.  *TT

THIS LETTER IS TO INFORM YOU THAT OUR 1994 LINCOLN CONTINENTAL VIN # [XXX], HAS BEEN RECENTLY DIAGNOSED WITH A BLOWN HEAD GASKET. THE VEHICLE HAS ONLY 58,000 MILES AND IS IN EXCELLENT CONDITION! THE PROBLEM THAT WE ARE FACING IS THAT WE ARE BEING TOLD THAT WE ARE PAST THE EXTENDED 7 YEAR OR 100,000 MILE WARRANTY. APPARENTLY, IT EXPIRED IN NOV. 2001. SO FAR WE HAVE SPOKEN WITH 3 DIFFERENT FORD REPRESENTATIVES AND ALL HAVE GIVEN US CONFLICTING REPORTS. WE HAVE DISCOVERED THAT THE DAMAGE IS COMMON, AS OUTLINED IN YOUR TECHNICAL SERVICE BULLETIN (ARTICLE NO. 98-4-9) AND THAT THE VEHICLE IS UNDER THE RECALL CAMPAIGN # 00M09 WE ARE ASKING THAT YOU AUTHORIZE OUR LOCAL FORD DEALER TO REPAIR THE DAMAGE UNDER THE WARRANTY. PLEASE RESPOND WITH A DECISION BY FRIDAY 2/8/02.  *AK    INFORMATION REDACTED PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).  *TR
